definition: To issue authoritative instructions or commands, often in a formal or hierarchical context, indicating a superior-subordinate relationship. It is commonly employed in military, organizational, or official settings to convey orders or directives.

examples.english: I command you to stop immediately!

examples.german: Der General befiehlt seinen Soldaten, voranzumarschieren.
examples.english: The general orders his soldiers to advance.

examples.german: Mein Vater befiehlt mir, das Zimmer aufzuräumen.
examples.english: My father commands me to tidy up the room.

examples.german: Der König befahl, dass der Dieb gefangen genommen wird.
examples.english: The king ordered that the thief be captured.

examples.german: Sie befiehlt ihrem Hund, Sitz zu machen.
examples.english: She commands her dog to sit.
